sub_topic: Probability of a certain weather event occurring
message_1: A weather forecaster has predicted that there is a 60% chance of rain in the city on a certain day. What is the probability that it will not rain on that day?
message_2:
The probability of an event not occurring is equal to 1 minus the probability of the event occurring. In this case, the probability of rain is 60%, or 0.6. Therefore, the probability of it not raining is:

1 - 0.6 = 0.4

So, there is a 40% chance that it will not rain on that day.
